snippet: Data indicate that Beijing may have to resort to more stimulus measures to avert job losses and debt default in the world’s second-largest economy.
abstract: China, after turbulent 2014, seems to be starting 2015 weakly, bolstering forecasts that the world's second-largest economy will increase stimulus measures to avert slowdown.
lead_paragraph: Data indicate that Beijing may have to resort to more stimulus measures to avert job losses and debt default in the world’s second-largest economy.

headline.main: China’s Economy Faces Sluggish Start for New Year
headline.print_headline: China Facing Sluggish Start for New Year
